intro: Pentagonia lanciloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
